hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Stress Transition via Parabolic Move & Sentiment Extreme
hypothesis_content.statement: During BULL regimes, a parabolic price move (45°+ angle) lasting >7 days combined with retail sentiment extreme (social volume spike + extreme greed reading) signals imminent transition to STRESS regime, creating a mean-reversion short entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Parabolic moves in BULL regimes are unsustainable. Combined with extreme retail sentiment and exchange inflows (profit-taking), they create conditions for a sharp, high-volatility correction. The transition from greed to panic (STRESS) often occurs rapidly at these inflection points.
entry_conditions: BTC 7-day price angle > 45 degrees (calculated via linear regression slope)
Crypto Fear & Greed Index > 80 (Extreme Greed) for 3+ days
Aggregated social media mentions (BTC) > 90th percentile of 30-day range
Exchange net flow turns positive (inflows > outflows) for 2 consecutive days

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% price depreciation from entry OR regime transitions to STRESS (confidence > 0.7)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC makes new 3-day high after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such parabolic extensions continue for >10 days without significant correction (>15%), defying mean reversion expectations.
